packagegui.name: netsnmp_communities
packagegui.title: NET-SNMP

field.description:
Communities are used in SNMPv1 and SNMPv2c to control access to SNMP data. Due to the nature of SNMP, this mechanism is insecure as it is only a single password-like string and all information is transmitted in plain text.

When SNMPv1 or SNMPv2c are in use, ensure that the daemon is secured by firewall rules and that any transmission of data happens over a local or encrypted connection.
Select the type of access this community will have.
The IP address family for this community.

Restrict access to a specified address or subnet which must match the Address Family above. Leave blank to allow full access.
Enter "default" to set a base OID without specifying a network source.
Restrict the community to part of the tree rooted at this OID. Leave blank to allow full access.
